text: We're finally going back to where we belong.
speaker: A

text: The Colosseum.
speaker: A

text: Oh, you should see the Colosseum, Spaniard.
speaker: A

text: 50,000 Romans.
speaker: A

text: watching every movement of your sword,
speaker: A

text: willing you to make that killer blow.
speaker: A

text: The silence before you strike,
speaker: A

text: and the noise afterwards.
speaker: A

text: It rises, it rises up like, like...
speaker: A

text: like a storm!
speaker: A

text: As if you were the Thunder God himself.
speaker: A

text: You were a gladiator.
speaker: B

text: Yes, I was.
speaker: A

text: You won your freedom.
speaker: B

text: A long time ago, the Emperor...
speaker: A

text: presented me with the Rudeus, it's...
speaker: A

text: just a...
speaker: A

text: wooden sword.
speaker: A

text: A symbol of your freedom.
speaker: A

text: He touched me on the shoulder, and I was free.
speaker: A

text: You knew Marcus Aurelius?
speaker: B

text: I did not say I knew him. I said he touched me on the shoulder once.
speaker: A

text: You ask me what I want.
speaker: B

text: I, too, want to stand in front of the Emperor.
speaker: B

text: As you did.
speaker: B

text: Then listen to me.
speaker: A

text: Learn from me.
speaker: A

text: I wasn't the best because I kill quickly.
speaker: A

text: I was the best because the crowd loved me.
speaker: A

text: Win the crowd, and you'll win your freedom.
speaker: A

text: I will win the crowd.
speaker: B

text: I will give them something they've never seen before.
speaker: B

text: So, Spaniard, we shall go to Rome together,
speaker: A

text: and have bloody adventures. And the great whore will suckle us until we are fat and happy and can suckle no more. And then,
speaker: A

text: when enough men have died,
speaker: A

text: perhaps you will have your freedom.
speaker: A

text: Here.
speaker: A

text: Use this.
speaker: A
